intro: Astragalus mulfordiae, commonly known as Mulford's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Astragalus mulfordiae is considered a rare and endangered species.
